content.description:
Would love to add FA, name and original grade if you know them!

Sit start with hands matched on a low pinch/rail. Follow the obvious holds through the overhang until you can use the crack/flake on the slab above to mantle over the top.

Follow the seam to the left to down climb.
content.location: The low overhang that is the closest problem to the trail. Upriver from the campfire overhang

content.description: Do a sit start off of a rail. Keep your legs from getting pretzeled as you work up to a non-obvious  pinch. Good holds finish the problem from the pinch.
content.location: This problem is located on the closest boulder to the Buchanan Pass trail but opposite the trail. A spotter is recommended due to a tree stump at the bottom of the problem.

climbs.name: Fire Tower Lookout
climbs.fa: Camilla Restrepo (found and established by Gina Loftus )

content.description:
This is a slap to the right of the

Campfirst Overhang

(V2). The starting hold is 6 feet from the base of the boulder. There are solid jugs up.

You can

downclimb or top off.
content.location:
Directly right of the

Campfire Overhang

(V2), it’s the first slab under the roof to the right.

The second slab can be used for good feet if you chose to downclimb.

content.description: A sit start on sidepulls lead to hidden jugs to finish the problem.
content.location: Look for remnants of an old camp fire in an alcove on the NNE side of the largest boulder in the area (right next to the climber's trail leading to the Warm-up Area). Old camp fire rocks litter the bottom of the problem.

content.description:
This route is a large offwidth crack to the left of the

Campfire Overhang

(V2) on the Warm-up Boulders. The start hold is the juggy slab of granite in the middle of the crack.

This route TOPS OUT, you can exit on opposite side of the boulder.
content.location:
It is on the right side of

Campfire Overhang

on Warm-Up Boulders. It is a 15 minutes walk from the roundabout parking lot after Camp Dick.

Look to the right for an obvious trail leading to a 20+ foot boulder.
